com.tomtom.speedtools.checksums

Class SHA1Hash

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomtom.speedtools.checksums.SHA1Hash

  • public final class SHA1Hash
extends Object
    Class for SHA1 hashes.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • hash

        @Nonnull
public static SHA1Hash hash(@Nonnull
                                     String value)
        Hashes the given value without salt. Note that in case the hashing process fails, an object will be returned that contains an empty string for its hash.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to hash.
        Returns:
        The hashed value.

      • saltedHash

        @Nonnull
public static SHA1Hash saltedHash(@Nonnull
                                           String value)
        Hashes the given value using a salt generated during the hash operation. Each invocation of this method, even for the same value, will use a different salt. Note that is the salt generation fails, hashing will proceed using no salt, and the returned object will contain an empty string for its salt value. Note that in case the hashing process fails, an object will be returned that contains an empty string for its hash.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to hash using salt.
        Returns:
        The hashed value using salt.

      • saltedHash

        @Nonnull
public static SHA1Hash saltedHash(@Nonnull
                                           String value,
                                           @Nonnull
                                           String salt)
        Hashes the given value using the provided salt. Note that in case the hashing process fails, an object will be returned that contains an empty string for its hash.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to hash using salt using the given salt.
        salt - The salt to use to hash the given value with. Can be an empty string, in which case no salt will be used. If not empty, must be a hex-encoded string (see HexString.getHexByteArray(String) for further requirements on non-empty salt values).
        Returns:
        The hashed value using the given salt.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the salt string contains non-hex characters.

      • getSalt

        @Nonnull
public String getSalt()
        Returns the salt used during hashing as a hex-encoded string. Can be an empty string if no salt was used, or salt generation failed.
        Returns:
        Salt for this hash.
